text: I simply just want to put in a button in an email instead of an ugly link. It seems strange that that is not possible :confused:
thanks for letting me know about that channel

<@UB380RRMM> you could embed the PDF on that landing page. You could create some javascript on that page to automatically open the PDF in a new window. You could email the PDF in a link and count the link clicks. you could use a CTA as a pdf download link and that would count the views.

In the end, if you really want to count something as a web page view, make it a web page.
It’s fairly new actually (within the past month)

I have to important any flex-box in my menus cause hub-spot adds a display block on click now and it jacks up my menu.
#itsnotafeature
nick, you are very wise. thanks for the good advice.

If you need assistance implementing any of those strategies let me know. I've done them all at some point lol
weird never seen that. then again been a long time since I’ve needed to flex dropdown items
<@U38EZFVFE> can you do a on click for the links, and if it is only a # have it prevent default stop immediate propagation and return false (all just for good measure lol)
or remove classes upon the menu loading
Check the dom. the HubSpot javascript ads a click event to the menu that adds display block amongst other things
that cause that to happen
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/FBJ6PUYKC/screen_shot_2018-07-03_at_9.46.37_am.jpg|Screen Shot 2018-07-03 at 9.46.37 AM.jpg>
do PDF embeds work ok on mobile? that is my only concern.

also seeing the same thing occurring on click of an advanced menu link with a dropdown. Looks like it's toggling that `open-list-menu` class as well.
the way we fixed it was for the non-active state of the dropdown to also have `display:flex !important; opacity: 0; pointer-events: none` and then to reset them on hover.
The javascript that inlined those styles on the dropdown menu still happen, but at least we've retained the styles we wanted.
<@U38EZFVFE> <@UAQHN1F2Q> do your menu modules have “Enable Flyouts?” set to false or `enable_flyouts=false`?
i can check
Yes it is.
Can you dm me an example?
So that is probably what it is. BUT why would they inline that?
of?
front end or back end?
Sorry, were flyouts enabled or disabled?
They were enabled.
Gotcha, false alarm, don’t need an example

We’ve always handled flyouts via CSS if they were enabled which was pretty easy to code around but recently made some A11Y improvements which involves loading JS to make sure items are “visible” and to set `aria` attributes
In these cases, did this affect live pages or stuff in development?
In development for sure. Not sure about past projects.

HMM. It has been a minute since I've done this. I can't guarantee that mobile browsers are going to be able to handle this properly without testing it.  Sticking a pdf in an iframe may work.  As a fall back I'd add a button that only displays on smaller screen sizes above the embed that says "PDF not displaying properly? Click here to open in a new window"
Which, is probably a good thing to have on mobile for just about everything you embed
<@U26B530N6> flyouts was enabled on the menu module, but even disabling that looks to have no effect

scratch that, it did stop the inline-styles being set.
had just realized I set `flyouts="false"` on my template's mobile menu (which is already limiting to only the top level anyway...) not the main-nav.
thanks i will try this out!
#lesson : if you want custom flyouts, disable HubSpot flyouts.
Thanks for the insight <@UAX5LJ9K3>! :raised_hands:
